meanings.definition: An arm or leg of a person or four-legged animal.
meanings.sent1: She hurt her limb while playing outside.
meanings.sent2: The dog wagged its limb happily.
meanings.sent3: The limb waved back at her.
meanings.sent4: His limb of support never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The limb carried her through the race.

meanings.definition: A large branch of a tree.
meanings.sent1: The limb of the tree provided shade on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: A squirrel jumped from limb to limb in the tree.
meanings.sent3: The limb swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The limb reached out like a welcoming hand.
meanings.sent5: The limb held the weight of the swinging tire.

meanings.definition: A projecting part of a structure.
meanings.sent1: The limb of the crane extended to reach the top floor.
meanings.sent2: The limb of the building cast a shadow on the street below.
meanings.sent3: The limb of the bridge seemed to beckon to passersby.
meanings.sent4: The limb of the tower loomed over the city.
meanings.sent5: The limb of the antenna transmitted signals across the airwaves.
